result.execSummary:
The defendant Alicia E Thunder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 5 days only if revoked.
Concurrent with: 15CM143

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, no entry into any bar or tavern and no possession of alcohol.

The defendant must enroll and successfully complete an anger management class and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must submit a DNA sample.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Alicia E Thunder in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Defendant Alicia E Thunder in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:02 PM. Called 15CM10, 15CM143, 16CF155, 16TR418 and 16TR417. Ferguson - on 16CF155 - dismiss and read in counts #1 and #2, count #3 - plead G as alleged with joint recommendation of a fine of $500 plus costs and surcharges, count #4 - plead G as alleged - joint recommendation of a withheld sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: free to argue jail time, AODA and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no posession oof alcohol and no entry into any bars, taverns or Class B establishments, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 200 hours of community service, both traffic citations will be dismissed. State agrees. Court dismisses and reads in counts #1 and #2 on 16CF155 and dismisses 16TR417 and 16TR418. Thunder pleads G to counts #3 and #4 on 16CF155. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State asks if the sentencing after revocation hearings can be done at same time. Ferguson and Thunder agree. State - 15CM10 - 24 days credit, 15CM143 - 53 days credit, additional 110 days that can be applied to either case - has reviewed the revocation summary packet - recommends court apply the 134 days credit to 15CM110 and 163 days credit to 15CM143 and give her credit for time served and run concurrent to each other, State makes final argument prior to sentencing  - follow joint recommendation on count #3, follow joint recommendation on count #4 and recommends 180 in jail commencing today and probation on new case commencing today. Ferguson has slightly different amounts for credit, has 136 days credit on 15CM10 and 184 days on 15CM143 - counting today towards those credit amounts. State would be willing to stipulate to those amounts. Ferguson makes final argument prior to sentencing - 15CM10 - ask for time served (135 days), on 15CM143 - ask for time served (183 days credit), 16CF155 - follow joint recommendation on count #3, follow joint recommendation on count #4 - recommends the Court impose 90 days of jail, stay all but 30 days of it and make that stay contingent upon her completing an inpatient treatment program. Thunder makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 15CM10 - 135 days in FC jail - 165 dyas creidt, 15CM143 - 183 days in jail - credit for 183 days; count #3 - #500.00 fine plus costs and surcharges - 60 DTP upon release from custody on count #4/CO; count #4 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, no posession of alcohol and no entry into any bars, taverns or Class B establishments, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, submit DNA sample with expunction right given, costs on count #4 - 60 DTP upon release from custody/CO, 120 days in FC jail - stay 60 days and if complete an inpatient treatment program within the first year of probation - 60 stayed jail time will remain stayed unless conditions of probation are violated - begin jail time today - huber allowed, no additional credit on this case, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 6, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
from counsel to Judge Bloom and Judge Stenz regarding substitution of judges for judicial economy
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 24, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Alicia E Thunder in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 3:31 PM. Also called 14TR727, 15CM10 and 15CM143. Ferguson - 15CM143 is set for AIA but have reached a global agreement on all matters. Ferguson - dismiss 14TR727, 15CM01 - dismiss only count, 15CM10 - plead NC to only count as alleged with joint recommendation of a withheld sentence and place on probation for 18 months with conditions of: pay court costs, AODA and follow thru, anger management assessment and follow thru, absolute sobriety and no entry into any bars or taverns and no possession of alcohol, employment/school, 50 hours of community service.  State - restitution demand of $275.00 to DOC plus $27.50 VW surcharge totalling $302.50; 15CM143 - plead to count #2 as alleged and same sentence as previous probation with same conditions except no additional community service, DRI remaining counts. State and Thunder agree. Court dismisses 15TR147 and dismisses and reads in counts #1 and #3 on 15CM143 and dismisses 15CM01. Thunder pleads NC to other counts as previously stated. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing, follow joint recommendation. Ferguson makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Thunder makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 15CM10 - count #1 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 18 months with conditions of: pay court costs - take bond posted, AODA and follow thru, anger management assessment and follow thru, absolute sobriety and no entry into any bars or taverns and no possession of alcohol, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 50 hours of community service, restitution of $302.50 including VW surcharge - take bond posted; 15CM143 - count #2 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 18 months - concurrent to 15CM10, with same conditions except no additional community service or restitution, court costs - take bond posted, of: pay court costs - take bond posted, AODA and follow thru, anger management assessment and follow thru, absolute sobriety and no entry into any bars or taverns and no possession of alcohol, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 50 hours of community service, restitution of $302.50 including VW surcharge - take bond posted - remainder due thru probation, submit DNA sample and gives expungement instructions regarding DNA, credit for 5 days on 15CM10 and 4 days credit on 15CM143 - only if revoked, right to appeal, adjourned.
No consumption of alcohol. No entry into any bars or taverns.

Defendant Alicia E Thunder in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin via telephone. Judge Bloom appears via video from Oneida County Courtroom. Also called 15CM01. Here for bail bond hearing. Ferguson updates court on current situation of her defendant and would like to set bond on these matters today and asks for judicial transfer of 15CM143 so all matters could be heard by Judge Bloom and track together. Court - in regards to 15CM143, judge does not have objection to transferring that case. State - suggests Ferguson contact Judge Stenz to see if this matter could be transferred to Judge Bloom for judicial economy. Ferguson suggests asking Judge Stenz for judicial transfer which is scheduled for AIA on 9/2/15. Court - for cases we are here for today are currently set for PLEAS on 9/14/15 and new case could be heard on that date. State - bond - stipulate to a signature bond on both cases with conditions of no consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns. Court - $1500 signature bond on each case with conditions of no consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns. Ferguson - informed by clerk that 14TR727 which was tracking with these cases also has a warrant and asks that the warrant be quashed. State does not object. Court - quash warrant on traffic citation and track with other cases.
Objection to bond forfeiture and request for hearing.

Attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:17 PM. Also called 14TR727 and 15CM10. Ferguson is not aware of why the defendant is not here, here today for PLEAS. State asks for forfeiture of any bond posted and bench warrant, body or $500.00 on each case. Court so orders.

ADDRESS INFO for Alicia E Thunder

Prior: 601 N Central Avenue, Crandon, WI 54520

Defendant Alicia E Thunder in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Defendant Alicia E Thunder in custody.  Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:04 AM. Also called 14TR727 (tracks with 15CM01), 15CM01 and 15CM10. On 14CF38 - here on SEHR and INIT on other two cases and STC on traffic matter. Ferguson has complaints on 15CM01 and 15CM10, waives reading, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court will set both those matters and traffic matter for PTC on 4/7/15 at 11:00 AM. Court has reviewed the revocation package on 14CF38. State has revocation paperwork, does not see any errors or inaccuracies, 68 days credit, count #3 - recommends 7 months in FC jail - consecutive to 13CM302 that she is currently serving. Ferguson makes final argument prior to sentencing - believes the defendant is entitled to 73 days credit - recommends any sentence run concurrent to 13CM302 - State and Ferguson now stipulate to 74 days credit. Thunder makes statement, remorseful. Court puts on record that he was not the sentencing judge and would need a waiver from defendant to have him sentence her on the revocation portion. Off record at 10:20 AM to allow counsel to discuss the matter/waiver with the defendant. Back on record at 10:21 AM, defendant has waived the requirement that this court official review the transcripts of the original sentence prior to sentencing her on revocation, Court feels comfortable going forth with today's sentencing and sentences the defendant to the following: 7 months in FC jail - concurrent to 13CM302 - credit for 74 days - huber allowed, turn any unpaid financial obligations into civil judgment, right to appeal, adjourned. Court - 15CM10 - $1000.00 signature bond, amend bond on 15CM01 to $1000 signature bond, no consumption of intoxicants in any amount and no presence on any tavern premises.
No consumption of intoxicants in any amount and no presence on any tavern premises.
Defendant is in custody at FOSO - sent notice to FOSO
